seo.title: DevTools - Free Developer Tools
seo.description: Collection of free tools for developers: UUID Generator, Password Generator, QR Code and more.

uuid.title: Online UUID Generator - v4 (Random) & v1 (Timestamp)
uuid.description: Free online UUID generator. Create Version 4 (Random) and Version 1 (Time-based/MAC) UUIDs in bulk. RFC 4122 compliant tool for developers.

article.title: Online UUID Generator
article.p1: **Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs)** are 128-bit numbers used to uniquely identify information in computer systems. They are a standard component in software architecture, allowing distributed systems to generate unique keys without significant coordination or a central authority. This tool generates fully compliant RFC 4122 UUIDs for use in databases, application logic, and testing environments.
article.p_versions: While there are five versions of UUIDs, this tool focuses on the two most common. **Version 4 (Random)** is generated using random numbers and is perfect for primary keys where privacy is a concern, as it contains no information about the host machine. **Version 1 (Timestamp)** uses the current time and the MAC address of the device, making it useful for scenarios where you need sortable, time-ordered identifiers.
article.p_collision: One of the most common questions is about uniqueness. The theoretical probability of a collision (generating the same UUID twice) is astronomically low. You would need to generate billions of UUIDs per second for many years to reach a 50% probability of a single collision. This reliability makes them the industry standard for identifying resources in modern web applications and microservices.
article.p_usecase: UUIDs are ubiquitous in modern development. They are used as primary keys in databases (like PostgreSQL and MongoDB), transaction IDs in payment gateways, and session tokens in web applications. Having a quick, reliable online generator allows developers to instantly create valid IDs for mocking data, testing API endpoints, or manual database insertions.

password.title: Strong Password Generator - Secure & Random Online Tool
password.description: Generate secure, highly random passwords instantly. Protect your accounts with high-entropy credentials using customizable length and character sets.

article.title: Strong Password Generator
article.p1: In the modern digital landscape, the security of your accounts relies heavily on the strength of your passwords. A **strong password generator** is an essential tool for creating complex credentials that are mathematically resistant to brute-force attacks and dictionary hacks. Unlike human-generated passwords, which often follow predictable patterns (like "Password123" or birthdates), machine-generated passwords maximize entropy, making them virtually impossible to guess.
article.p_randomness: True security comes from unpredictability. This tool uses a **Cryptographically Secure Pseudo-Random Number Generator (CSPRNG)** to ensure that every character is selected without bias. This is critical for developers and system administrators who need to generate API keys, salts, or initial user passwords that cannot be reverse-engineered.
article.p_custom: Different systems have different requirements. You can easily adjust the password length (up to 64 characters) and toggle the inclusion of numbers and symbols. Whether you need a short alphanumeric code or a maximum-security 64-character string for a master key, this tool adapts to your specific security policies.
article.p_privacy: Your security is our priority. All password generation happens locally in your browser (client-side). We do not store, transmit, or log any passwords generated by this tool. Once the page is refreshed, the generated data is gone forever, ensuring complete privacy for your sensitive credentials.

qrcode.title: Free QR Code Generator - Create URL, Text & WiFi Codes
qrcode.description: Create static QR codes for unlimited scanning. Generate codes for URLs, WiFi networks, and plain text. Download high-resolution PNGs instantly.

article.title: Free QR Code Generator
article.p1: A **Quick Response (QR) codes** have become a universal bridge between the physical and digital worlds. This tool allows you to generate static QR codes instantly directly from your browser. Unlike dynamic codes offered by some services that expire or require a subscription, the codes generated here encode the data directly into the image. This means they will work forever, do not track users, and are completely free to use.
article.p_versatile: Our generator supports multiple data formats to suit your needs. You can encode **URLs** to direct users to your website or portfolio. You can create **WiFi codes** that allow guests to scan and connect to your network without typing complex passwords. You can even encode **plain text**, enabling you to share messages, serial numbers, or contact information offline.
article.p_quality: Readability is key. The tool generates high-contrast, clean images optimized for scanning by all modern smartphones (iOS and Android). You can download the result as a high-resolution PNG file, perfect for printing on flyers, business cards, or product packaging without losing quality or becoming unreadable.
article.p_privacy: Because these are static QR codes, the data is fixed and lives entirely within the square pattern of the image. No data is sent to a server for tracking or redirection. This ensures that your links go exactly where you intend them to, without third-party interference or the risk of link rot if a service provider goes offline.

hash.title: Online Hash Generator - Calculate MD5, SHA-256, SHA-512
hash.description: Generate cryptographic hashes from text strings. Secure online calculator for MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, and SHA-512 algorithms. Verify data integrity.

article.title: Online Hash Generator
article.p1: Cryptographic hash functions are the backbone of modern data security and integrity. This tool serves as a versatile online calculator, allowing you to convert any text input into a fixed-size string of characters, known as a checksum or hash. Supporting standard algorithms like **MD5**, **SHA-1**, **SHA-256**, and **SHA-512**, it provides developers and security researchers with a quick way to verify logic or generate test data.
article.p_integrity: One of the primary uses of hashing is verification. By comparing the hash of a file or string against a known value, you can confirm that the data has not been altered or corrupted. This is commonly used in software distribution to verify that a downloaded file matches the original source, ensuring it hasn't been tampered with during transfer.
article.p_algorithms: Not all hashes are created equal. **MD5** and **SHA-1** are older algorithms; while fast and useful for non-security checksums, they are no longer recommended for storing secrets due to collision vulnerabilities. **SHA-256** and **SHA-512**, part of the SHA-2 family, offer significantly stronger security and are the industry standards for digital signatures, SSL certificates, and password hashing (when combined with salt).
article.p_encryption: It is important to understand that hashing is not encryption. It is a one-way process; you cannot reverse a hash to retrieve the original text. This property is what makes it ideal for storing password proofs (hashes) in databases. Even if the database is compromised, the actual passwords remain hidden, provided that strong, slow hashing algorithms are used.

password_api-key-generator.title: Random API Key Generator - Secure & Unique Tokens
password_api-key-generator.description: Generate secure, high-entropy API keys for your applications. Create random cryptographic tokens for authentication systems and secret management.

article.title: Random API Key Generator
article.p1: Developing authentication systems requires strong, unpredictable secrets. This **Random API Key Generator** is designed specifically for developers who need to issue secure access tokens, client secrets, or session identifiers. Unlike standard passwords, API keys often require a specific structure or length to ensure maximum security against collision and guessing attacks.
article.p_randomness: By utilizing a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator (CSPRNG), this tool produces strings that are statistically random. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity of your API. A predictable key generation algorithm could allow attackers to reverse-engineer valid tokens, compromising your entire user base.
article.p_custom: Use this tool to generate 64-character (512-bit) alphanumeric strings commonly used in OAuth implementations, JWT signing secrets, and service-to-service communication. All generation happens locally in your browser, so your generated secrets never touch our servers.
article.p_privacy: Your security is our priority. All generation happens locally in your browser (client-side). We do not store, transmit, or log any keys generated by this tool.

password_wifi-wpa2-generator.title: WPA2 Wi-Fi Password Generator - Max Security Keys
password_wifi-wpa2-generator.description: Create uncrackable WPA2/WPA3 Wi-Fi passwords. Generate random 63-character keys to secure your home or office network against brute-force attacks.

article.title: WPA2 Wi-Fi Password Generator
article.p1: Your wireless network is only as secure as its password. Default router passwords or simple phrases are primary targets for tools like Aircrack-ng or Hashcat. This **Wi-Fi Password Generator** helps you create the strongest possible protection for your network by leveraging the full capacity of the WPA2 and WPA3 protocols.
article.p_randomness: For maximum security, a WPA2 pre-shared key (PSK) can be up to 63 characters long. Using a full-length, random alphanumeric string drastically increases the computational power required to crack your network handshake, moving the time-to-crack from minutes to centuries.
article.p_custom: We recommend generating a long string including symbols and numbers. While typing it into your devices might be tedious once, the peace of mind knowing your network is immune to dictionary attacks is worth the effort. Perfect for securing corporate guest networks or high-value home setups.
article.p_privacy: Your security is our priority. All generation happens locally in your browser (client-side). We do not store, transmit, or log any passwords generated by this tool.

password_high-entropy-string.title: High-Entropy String Generator - Random Data for Devs
password_high-entropy-string.description: Generate high-entropy random strings for salt values, crypto seeds, and testing data. Pure client-side generation for maximum privacy.

article.title: High-Entropy String Generator
article.p1: Entropy is a measure of randomness and unpredictability. In cryptography and software testing, you often need raw, unstructured data that follows no pattern. This **High-Entropy String Generator** allows you to produce character sequences that maximize Shannon entropy, ideal for seeding random number generators or creating unique database salts.
article.p_randomness: Low-entropy strings are the enemy of security. If your 'random' values usually start with a letter or contain dictionary words, they are vulnerable to pattern analysis. This tool treats every character position as an independent event, drawing from a full set of ASCII characters to ensure uniform distribution.
article.p_custom: Beyond security, this tool is excellent for 'fuzzing' or testing input validation. By feeding high-entropy, complex strings into your application's input fields, you can uncover edge cases and handling errors that normal user input wouldn't trigger.
article.p_privacy: Your security is our priority. All generation happens locally in your browser (client-side). We do not store, transmit, or log any strings generated by this tool.

uuid_bulk-generator.title: Bulk UUID Generator - Create 100+ UUIDs Instantly
uuid_bulk-generator.description: Generate thousands of UUIDs in a single click. Free bulk UUID generator tool for populating mock databases, CSVs, and testing large datasets.

article.title: Bulk UUID Generator
article.p1: When setting up a new database or testing an application's scalability, generating identifiers one by one is inefficient. This **Bulk UUID Generator** streamlines the process, allowing you to create hundreds or thousands of universally unique identifiers effectively instantly.
article.p_versions: This tool applies the RFC 4122 standard to every single ID generated, ensuring that even in batch operations, the uniqueness guarantee holds true. This is particularly useful for developers populating seed data for SQL databases (like PostgreSQL `uuid` columns) or NoSQL document stores (like MongoDB `_id` fields).
article.p_collision: Simply specify the quantity you need, and copying the entire list to your clipboard. The output is formatted perfectly for pasting into JSON files, CSV spreadsheets, or SQL insert statements, saving you hours of manual script writing.
article.p_usecase: UUIDs are ubiquitous in modern development. They are used as primary keys in databases (like PostgreSQL and MongoDB), transaction IDs in payment gateways, and session tokens in web applications. Having a quick, reliable online generator allows developers to instantly create valid IDs for mocking data, testing API endpoints, or manual database insertions.

uuid_online-guid.title: Online GUID Generator - Microsoft Style Identifiers
uuid_online-guid.description: Create Microsoft GUIDs (Globally Unique Identifiers) online. Compatible with C#, .NET, and Windows Registry formats. Free and secure.

article.title: Online GUID Generator
article.p1: In the Microsoft ecosystem, UUIDs are commonly referred to as **GUIDs (Globally Unique Identifiers)**. While the underlying 128-bit structure is the same as the standard UUID, the terminology and typical usage contexts often differ. This **Online GUID Generator** is tailored for .NET developers, Windows system administrators, and C# programmers.
article.p_versions: Whether you are defining a `CLSID` for a COM component, setting up a unique identifier for a Windows Registry key, or creating primary keys for MS SQL Server, a reliable GUID source is essential. This tool guarantees compliance with standard GUID formatting, including the specific hyphen placement (8-4-4-4-12 representation).
article.p_collision: Generate Version 4 (Random) GUIDs that are safe to use across all Windows versions and .NET frameworks without risk of collision. The random nature ensures they are unique globally, allowing for easy merging of databases.
article.p_usecase: UUIDs are ubiquitous in modern development. They are used as primary keys in databases (like PostgreSQL and MongoDB), transaction IDs in payment gateways, and session tokens in web applications. Having a quick, reliable online generator allows developers to instantly create valid IDs for mocking data, testing API endpoints, or manual database insertions.

uuid_v4.title: UUID v4 Generator - Random RFC 4122 IDs
uuid_v4.description: Generate strictly random Version 4 UUIDs. RFC 4122 compliant identifiers based on chaos/random seeds for maximum anonymity.

article.title: Random UUID v4 Generator
article.p1: **Version 4 UUIDs** are the industry standard for generic unique identifiers. Unlike Version 1, which incorporates the MAC address of the generating computer (potentially leaking privacy), v4 uses random or pseudo-random numbers for nearly all of its 128 bits. This **UUID v4 Generator** focuses exclusively on creating these privacy-preserving identifiers.
article.p_versions: The structure of a v4 UUID is defined by RFC 4122. It sets specific bits to indicate the version number (4) and the variant (IETF), leaving 122 bits for random data. This results in a total of 2^122 possible combinationsâ€”a number so large that the probability of a collision is effectively zero for all practical purposes.
article.p_collision: Use v4 UUIDs for public-facing resource IDs, session tokens, or transaction references where you want to ensure uniqueness without revealing the time or location of generation.
article.p_usecase: UUIDs are ubiquitous in modern development. They are used as primary keys in databases (like PostgreSQL and MongoDB), transaction IDs in payment gateways, and session tokens in web applications. Having a quick, reliable online generator allows developers to instantly create valid IDs for mocking data, testing API endpoints, or manual database insertions.

qrcode_wifi.title: WiFi QR Code Generator - Connect Without Passwords
qrcode_wifi.description: Create a QR code for your WiFi network. Allow guests to scan and connect instantly. Supports WPA, WPA2, and WEP networks.

article.title: WiFi QR Code Generator
article.p1: Sharing your home or office WiFi password can be a frustration. Spelling out complex keys often leads to errors. This **WiFi QR Code Generator** solves that problem by encoding your network credentials into a scannable image. Guests simply point their camera at the code, and their device prompts them to join the network automatically.
article.p_versatile: The logic follows the standard `WIFI:` string schema supported by Android and iOS. You can specify your SSID (network name), password, and encryption type (WPA/WPA2, WEP, or None). This is perfect for coffee shops, hotels, or simply for sticking on your fridge at home.
article.p_quality: Readability is key. The tool generates high-contrast, clean images optimized for scanning by all modern smartphones (iOS and Android). You can download the result as a high-resolution PNG file, perfect for printing on flyers, business cards, or product packaging without losing quality or becoming unreadable.
article.p_privacy: Security is paramount: the QR code is generated locally in your browser. Your sensitive WiFi password is never sent to our servers, so you can generate these codes with complete peace of mind.

qrcode_url-converter.title: URL to QR Code Converter - Link to App/Website
qrcode_url-converter.description: Convert any website URL into a scannable QR code. Create deep links for apps, social media, or marketing campaigns. Static and free.

article.title: URL to QR Code Converter
article.p1: In marketing and physical distribution, bridging the gap to digital content is crucial. This **URL to QR Code Converter** is the simplest way to turn any web link into a physical entry point. Whether it's a link to your restaurant menu, a download page for your app, or your LinkedIn profile, this tool creates a robust code ready for printing.
article.p_versatile: This generator creates **static QR codes**. Unlike dynamic codes that rely on a redirect service (which can go down or start charging fees), a static code encodes the actual URL character-by-character. This means your code will function as long as your website exists, with zero dependencies on our service.
article.p_quality: Optimized for short and long URLs alike, the tool ensures the error correction level is sufficient to be scanned even if printed on slightly textured paper or displayed on screens.
article.p_privacy: Because these are static QR codes, the data is fixed and lives entirely within the square pattern of the image. No data is sent to a server for tracking or redirection.

qrcode_printable.title: Printable QR Code Maker - High Resolution PNG
qrcode_printable.description: Generate high-resolution, print-ready QR codes. Ideal for flyers, business cards, and posters. Clean, sharp, and easy to scan.

article.title: Printable QR Code Maker
article.p1: When printing QR codes on physical media like business cards, posters, or merchandise, quality is everything. A blurry or low-resolution code can frustrate users and hurt your brand. This **Printable QR Code Maker** focuses on delivering high-fidelity outputs suitable for professional printing.
article.p_versatile: We generate large, crisp PNG files that maintain their sharpness when scaled. The high contrast ensures that even older smartphone cameras can pick up the pattern quickly. Ideal for marketing materials, packaging, and event signage.
article.p_quality: Before printing a large batch, we always recommend testing your code on multiple devices. Since these are standard ISO 18004 compliant codes, they are compatible with all standard barcode reading hardware and software ensuring a seamless experience for your end users.
article.p_privacy: Because these are static QR codes, the data is fixed and lives entirely within the square pattern of the image. No data is sent to a server for tracking or redirection.

hash_md5-calculator.title: MD5 Checksum Calculator - Verify File Integrity
hash_md5-calculator.description: Calculate MD5 checksums for text strings online. Fast and simple tool to verify file integrity and generate fingerprints for data.

article.title: MD5 Checksum Calculator
article.p1: The MD5 (Message Digest Algorithm 5) has been a staple in computing for decades. While no longer suitable for cryptographic security due to collision vulnerabilities, it remains the most popular standard for verifying file integrity. This **MD5 Checksum Calculator** allows you to quickly generate the 32-character hexadecimal fingerprint of any text string.
article.p_integrity: Usage is common in software distribution. Developers provide an MD5 hash alongside their software downloads. After downloading, a user can hash the file locally; if the hashes match perfectly, the file is identical to the original and has not been corrupted during download.
article.p_algorithms: This tool focuses on speed and simplicity, giving you the MD5 output instantly as you type. It is an excellent utility for developers debugging data transfers or verifying legacy system credentials.
article.p_encryption: It is important to understand that hashing is not encryption. It is a one-way process; you cannot reverse a hash to retrieve the original text.

hash_sha256.title: SHA256 Generator - Secure SHA-2 Hashing
hash_sha256.description: Generate SHA-256 hashes online. Secure, standard SHA-2 algorithm for password hashing, digital signatures, and blockchain verification.

article.title: SHA256 Generator
article.p1: SHA-256 is part of the SHA-2 (Secure Hash Algorithm 2) family designed by the NSA. It is currently one of the most secure and widely used hashing algorithms in the world. This **SHA256 Generator** provides a reliable way to compute these 256-bit signatures directly in your browser.
article.p_integrity: Its uses are vast. SHA-256 is the fundamental cryptographic primitive underlying Bitcoin and much of the blockchain ecosystem. It is also the industry standard for SSL certificates and secure password storage (when properly salted).
article.p_algorithms: Unlike MD5 or SHA-1, SHA-256 has no known efficient collision attacks. This makes it safe for security-critical applications where ensuring that two different inputs never produce the same hash is vital. Use this tool to generate test vectors or verify security implementations.
article.p_encryption: It is important to understand that hashing is not encryption. It is a one-way process; you cannot reverse a hash to retrieve the original text.

hash_checksum-verifier.title: Online Checksum Verifier - Validate Data Integrity
hash_checksum-verifier.description: Free online tool to verify checksums. Compare text against MD5, SHA1, and SHA256 hashes to detect corruption or tampering.

article.title: Online Checksum Verifier
article.p1: Data corruption can happen silently during storage or transmission. A single flipped bit can render a backup useless or a script dangerous. This **Online Checksum Verifier** is designed to help you validate data integrity by allowing you to manually compute and compare hash string values.
article.p_integrity: By determining the 'digest' of your input text using various algorithms (MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256), you can cross-reference it with expected values. If the generated string matches your record, the data is intact.
article.p_algorithms: This tool is particularly useful for system administrators and developers who need to perform quick integrity checks without opening a command-line interface. It supports multiple algorithms simultaneously, listing them side-by-side for easy comparison.
article.p_encryption: It is important to understand that hashing is not encryption. It is a one-way process; you cannot reverse a hash to retrieve the original text.
